title: Buoyant force - normal force on block in pool

content.question: A block of iron, which has a density that is greater than the density of water, is at rest on the bottom of a pool. Which of the following claims about the magnitude of the normal force on the block and the weight of the block is true?

choices.label: The magnitude of the normal force on the block is less than the weight of the block.
The magnitude of the normal force on the block is equal to the weight of the block.
The magnitude of the normal force on the block is greater than the weight of the block.
The forces cannot be compared without knowing the ratio of the densities of iron and water.

content.answer: The magnitude of the normal force on the block is less than the weight of the block.

skill.text: 3.B: Apply an appropriate law, definition, theoretical relationship, or model to make a claim.
